text: Anisophyllea nitida is a tree of Borneo in the family Anisophylleaceae. The specific epithet ' is from the Latin meaning "polished", referring to the shiny appearance of the upper leaf surface. ==Description== Anisophyllea nitida grows as a tree up to tall with a trunk diameter of up to . The bark is smooth to scaly. The ellipsoid fruits measure up to long. ==Distribution and habitat== Anisophyllea nitida is endemic to Borneo. Its habitat is dipterocarp forests. ==References== nitida Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Endemic flora of Borneo Category:Plants described in 1993 Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Anisophyllea nitida
